Description: Amuletic string: composed of many large truncated convex bicone beads of cornelian, one cornelian lenticular bead, a flattened oval in shape and two cornelian face amulets. The backs are completely flat; on the slightly convex obverse crudely incised lines delineate the features. The ears are without detail. The slight projection on top of the head is pierced for stringing.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (437)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
